Lines.Text: firstly disconnect battery
'''always''' take the '''negative''' terminal off first .
''''''general tip''' after disconnecting the battery leave the car for about 10 mins , this lets any residual energy left in the electrical system to dissapate . it is good practise whatever the job

Steps.Text_raw: Firstly Disconnect  battery '''Always''' take the '''negative''' terminal off first. ''''''General Tip'''                                  After disconnecting the battery leave the car for about 10 mins , This lets any residual energy left in the electrical system to dissapate. It is good practise whatever the job

Lines.Text: locate throttle body on right side of engine , it is between the intake tube and intake manifold .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate throttle body on right side of engine, it is between the intake tube and intake manifold.

Lines.Text: locate throttle linkage cable assembly .
twist the assembly clockwise .
slide both slackened cables off assemblys guides .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide both slackened cables off assembly’s guides.

Lines.Text: locate the two hoses on the top of the throttle body .
gently lift the hoses off .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two hoses on the top of the throttle body. Gently lift the hoses off.

Lines.Text: use a flat head screwdriver to loosen the hose clamp attaching the intake tube to the throttle body .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a flat head screwdriver to loosen the hose clamp attaching the intake tube to the throttle body.

Lines.Text: remove the intake tube from the throttle body .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the intake tube from the throttle body.

Lines.Text: locate wiring clip on the underside of the throttle body .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate wiring clip on the underside of the throttle body.

Lines.Text: press down on the locking mechanism before gently removing the wiring clip .

Steps.Text_raw: Press down on the locking mechanism before gently removing the wiring clip.

Lines.Text: locate throttle linkage arm .
open the locking clip with a flat head screwdriver .
pry off the linkage arm with a flat head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate throttle linkage arm. Open the locking clip with a flat head screwdriver. Pry off the linkage arm with a flat head screwdriver.

Lines.Text: locate the three 13 mm nuts attaching the throttle body to the intake manifold .
remove nuts with a 13 mm crescent wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the three 13mm nuts attaching the throttle body to the intake manifold. Remove nuts with a 13mm crescent wrench.

Lines.Text: lift the throttle body off of the intake manifold .
the manifold is now out of the engine bay and ready for cleaning or adjustment .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the throttle body off of the intake manifold. The manifold is now out of the engine bay and ready for cleaning or adjustment.

Lines.Text: cover the electrical contacts with a shop towel to prevent throttle body cleaner from inadvertently spilling over .

Steps.Text_raw: Cover the electrical contacts with a shop towel to prevent throttle body cleaner from inadvertently spilling over.

Lines.Text: liberally apply throttle body cleaner to the inside of throttle body and butterfly valve .
use a shop towel sprayed with cleaner to wipe off thick grime if severely dirtied .

Steps.Text_raw: Liberally apply throttle body cleaner to the inside of throttle body and butterfly valve. Use a shop towel sprayed with cleaner to wipe off thick grime if severely dirtied.

Lines.Text: spray electrical cleaner on the metal contacts to blast away particles in the bracket .
spray off the wiring clip that attaches to the throttle body inside the engine bay .

Steps.Text_raw: Spray electrical cleaner on the metal contacts to blast away particles in the bracket. Spray off the wiring clip that attaches to the throttle body inside the engine bay.

Lines.Text: apply a small amount of dielectric grease to the metal contacts to prevent corrosion .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply a small amount of dielectric grease to the metal contacts to prevent corrosion.
